Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Narrative Techniques > Relating Personal Anecdotes > Connecting Stories to Messages
entries.annotation: The skill of linking personal stories to the main message or theme, such as using a personal experience to illustrate a key point.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Narrative Techniques > Relating Personal Anecdotes > Connecting with Audience
entries.annotation: The ability to use personal anecdotes to build a connection with the audience, like sharing relatable experiences.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Narrative Techniques > Relating Personal Anecdotes > Sharing Relevant Stories
entries.annotation: The ability to use personal anecdotes to make points more relatable and impactful, such as sharing a personal success story in a motivational speech.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Narrative Techniques > Using Storytelling Elements
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Narrative Techniques > Using Storytelling Elements > Crafting Narratives
entries.annotation: The ability to create engaging and meaningful narratives, like narrating a journey of overcoming challenges.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Narrative Techniques > Using Storytelling Elements > Structuring Narratives
entries.annotation: The knowledge of organizing storytelling elements into coherent and compelling narratives, such as developing a clear beginning, middle, and end.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Figuratives
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Figuratives > Using Metaphors and Analogies
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Figuratives > Using Metaphors and Analogies > Creating Comparisons
entries.annotation: The knowledge of using comparisons to make complex ideas more accessible, like saying "finding a needle in a haystack.".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Figuratives > Using Metaphors and Analogies > Creating Metaphors
entries.annotation: The ability to craft metaphors that clarify and illustrate points, like comparing a challenging task to climbing a mountain.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Figuratives > Using Metaphors and Analogies > Drawing Relevant Analogies
entries.annotation: The skill of creating analogies that are directly relevant to the topic and easy for the audience to understand, such as comparing teamwork to a sports team.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Avoiding Logical Fallacies
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Avoiding Logical Fallacies > Ensuring Logical Consistency
entries.annotation: The ability to construct arguments that are free from logical inconsistencies, such as verifying that all premises lead logically to the conclusion.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Avoiding Logical Fallacies > Recognizing Common Fallacies
entries.annotation: The skill of identifying typical logical fallacies in arguments, such as ad hominem attacks or slippery slope arguments.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Avoiding Logical Fallacies > Recognizing Fallacies in Speech
entries.annotation: The knowledge of spotting logical errors in spoken arguments, such as identifying false dilemmas or straw man fallacies in debates.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Recognizing Fallacies in Speech
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Recognizing Fallacies in Speech > Critiquing Invalid Reasoning
entries.annotation: The skill of analyzing and critiquing arguments based on their logical soundness, such as highlighting circular reasoning.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Recognizing Fallacies in Speech > Identifying Fallacies in Arguments
entries.annotation: The ability to detect logical fallacies within arguments during debates and discussions, like pointing out hasty generalizations.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Using Rhetorical Questions
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Using Rhetorical Questions > Formulating Rhetorical Questions
entries.annotation: The skill of creating questions designed to engage the audience and provoke thought, like asking "What if?" scenarios.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Using Rhetorical Questions > Provoking Thought
entries.annotation: The skill of using questions to encourage the audience to think deeply about the topic, like asking "How would you feel if...?".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Logic > Using Rhetorical Questions > Using Questions to Engage Audience
entries.annotation: The ability to use questions to maintain audience interest and involvement, such as posing thought-provoking questions during a lecture.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Appealing to Emotions
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Appealing to Emotions > Connecting with Audience Emotionally
entries.annotation: The ability to create an emotional bond with the audience through the use of stories, language, and personal connections, like sharing heartfelt anecdotes.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Appealing to Emotions > Using Emotional Language
entries.annotation: The skill of using language that evokes emotions to connect with the audience, such as describing vivid emotional experiences.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Applying Humor Appropriately
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Applying Humor Appropriately > Engaging Audience Laugh
entries.annotation: The skill of using humor effectively to connect with and entertain the audience, like incorporating light-hearted remarks to maintain engagement.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Applying Humor Appropriately > Enhancing Presentations with Wit
entries.annotation: The ability to incorporate wit and humor to make presentations more engaging and enjoyable, like using clever anecdotes.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Applying Humor Appropriately > Identifying Appropriate Humor
entries.annotation: The knowledge of recognizing suitable moments for humor within a presentation or discussion, like lightening the mood with a joke in a less formal setting.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Establishing Credibility
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Establishing Credibility > Building Trust with Audience
entries.annotation: The skill of creating and fostering trust between the presenter and the audience, like being transparent and ethical.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Establishing Credibility > Demonstrating Expertise
entries.annotation: The ability to establish oneself as an authority on the subject matter being presented, like highlighting relevant experience.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Establishing Credibility > Presenting Credentials
entries.annotation: The ability to present qualifications and credentials to bolster credibility, like mentioning academic degrees or certifications.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Making Legal Arguments
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Making Legal Arguments > Analyzing Past Events
entries.annotation: The skill of using historical and past events to construct logical and persuasive legal arguments, like referencing case precedents.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Motivating Action
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Motivating Action > Encouraging Decision-Making
entries.annotation: The skill of motivating the audience to take action or make decisions based on the presentation, like prompting a call to action.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Understanding Timing
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Understanding Timing > Choosing Appropriate Moments
entries.annotation: The ability to select the right moments for humor, arguments, or key points to enhance the presentation, such as pausing before making a significant remark.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Understanding Timing > Identifying Opportune Moments
entries.annotation: The ability to recognize the best moments to introduce key points or strategies, such as timing arguments for maximum impact in a debate.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Rhetorical Strategies > Understanding Timing > Timing Arguments Effectively
entries.annotation: The skill of making arguments at the right time for maximum impact, like presenting the strongest points during crucial moments in a speech.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Style
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Style > Adapting Speech Style
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Style > Adapting Speech Style > Adjusting Style to Context
entries.annotation: The skill of modifying speech style to suit the context of the presentation or discussion, such as using formal language in a business meeting.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Style > Adapting Speech Style > Tailoring Language to Audience
entries.annotation: The ability to customize language and presentation style according to the audience, such as using layman's terms for a general audience.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Style > Crafting Speech Style
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Style > Crafting Speech Style > Adapting Speech Style
entries.annotation: The skill of dynamically adjusting speech style to improve audience engagement and message delivery, such as shifting tone for emphasis.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Style > Crafting Speech Style > Developing Distinctive Style
entries.annotation: The knowledge of creating a unique and memorable speech style, such as using a conversational tone to connect with the audience.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Rhetorical Strategies > Style > Crafting Speech Style > Using Language Creatively
entries.annotation: The ability to use creative language techniques to enhance presentations, such as incorporating wordplay or vivid imagery.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Formal and Informal Speaking
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Formal and Informal Speaking > Formal Speaking Performance
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Formal and Informal Speaking > Formal Speaking Performance > Formal Speaking Performance
entries.annotation: The ability to plan and deliver clear, structured speeches and presentations for specific audiences.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Formal and Informal Speaking > Informal Speaking Performance
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Formal and Informal Speaking > Informal Speaking Performance > Informal Speaking Performance
entries.annotation: The ability to engage in coherent, fluent conversation and adapt register to context.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Active Listening
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Active Listening > Demonstrating Attentiveness
entries.annotation: The ability to show active engagement through non-verbal cues and responsive feedback, such as making eye contact and leaning forward.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Active Listening > Practicing Focused Listening
entries.annotation: The skill of maintaining focused and undistracted attention during conversation or presentation, such as avoiding multitasking while listening.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Active Listening > Providing Feedback
entries.annotation: The skill of giving feedback that demonstrates attentive listening and understanding, such as nodding and summarizing points made by the speaker.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Critical Listening
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Critical Listening > Analyzing Messages
entries.annotation: The ability to critically evaluate and analyze the messages conveyed by a speaker, such as assessing the logical coherence of arguments.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Critical Listening > Evaluating Credibility
entries.annotation: The skill of assessing the credibility and reliability of the information presented, such as checking the validity of sources cited by the speaker.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Critical Listening > Evaluating Information
entries.annotation: The ability to evaluate the accuracy and relevance of information received, such as discerning fact from opinion in a discussion.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Understanding Formal Vs Informal Register
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Understanding Formal Vs Informal Register > Adapting to Communication Contexts
entries.annotation: The skill of switching between formal and informal registers appropriately based on the context, such as using formal language in a job interview.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Listening > Understanding Formal Vs Informal Register > Identifying Register Differences
entries.annotation: The knowledge of distinguishing between formal and informal speech registers, such as recognizing the difference between casual conversation and professional presentation.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Formal Speaking
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Formal Speaking > Oral Presentation
entries.annotation: The skill of delivering structured and coherent presentations in front of an audience, such as presenting a project report.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Formal Speaking > Public Speaking
entries.annotation: The ability to speak effectively in front of an audience in formal settings, such as delivering a keynote address.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Informal Speaking
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Informal Speaking > Casual Conversations
entries.annotation: The skill of engaging naturally in everyday conversations, such as discussing weekend plans with friends.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Informal Speaking > Engaging in Casual Conversations
entries.annotation: The skill of participating in informal dialogues and interactions smoothly, such as chatting with colleagues during a break.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Informal Speaking > Engaging in Daily Dialogues
entries.annotation: The ability to participate in routine verbal interactions effectively, such as greeting coworkers and discussing daily tasks.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Informal Speaking > Transitioning Between Topics Smoothly
entries.annotation: The ability to transition between different topics in a conversation without disjointedness, such as moving from one subject to another fluidly.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Oral Presentation
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Oral Presentation > Designing Presentations
entries.annotation: The skill of creating visual and verbal content for effective presentations, such as designing slides and preparing speaking notes.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Oral Presentation > Speaking with Confidence
entries.annotation: The ability to deliver presentations confidently and assertively, such as maintaining a steady voice and direct eye contact.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Public Speaking
Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Public Speaking > Managing Speaking Anxiety
entries.annotation: The ability to cope with and reduce anxiety when speaking in public, such as practicing deep breathing techniques.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Oral Discourse > Speaking > Speaking > Public Speaking > Structuring Public Speeches
entries.annotation: The knowledge of organizing public speeches to ensure clarity and impact, such as using a clear introduction, body, and conclusion.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Apply Grammar and Usage in Context

levels.skill_set: Apply Grammar and Usage in Context

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Apply Grammar and Usage in Context > Apply Grammar and Usage in Context

levels.skill_set: Apply Grammar and Usage in Context
levels.skill_subset: Apply Grammar and Usage in Context

entries.annotation: The ability to apply grammar and usage accurately in authentic writing contexts.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Correcting Grammatical Errors
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Correcting Grammatical Errors > Correct Word Choice
entries.annotation: The ability to select the appropriate words to convey precise meanings and avoid usage errors, such as choosing "affect" instead of "effect" where appropriate.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Correcting Grammatical Errors > Correcting Usage Mistakes
entries.annotation: The skill of correcting common grammatical errors in writing to improve clarity and accuracy, such as switching "Their going to the party" to "They’re going to the party" in writing.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Identifying Grammatical Errors
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Identifying Grammatical Errors > Avoiding Common Errors
entries.annotation: The skill of recognizing and avoiding common grammatical mistakes in writing, such as using "less" with countable nouns instead of "fewer," like in "less apples" corrected to "fewer apples.".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Identifying Grammatical Errors > Recognizing Common Errors
entries.annotation: The ability to identify frequent grammatical mistakes in writing, such as subject-verb agreement and incorrect tense usage, such as subject-verb agreement errors in sentences like "She go to the store" (instead of "She goes to the store").

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Using Grammar Correctly
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Using Grammar Correctly > Applying Grammar in Writing
entries.annotation: The ability to apply grammar rules correctly in one's writing to enhance readability and accuracy, such as ensuring sentence variety and proper punctuation in complex sentences.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Grammar and Usage > Using Grammar Correctly > Understanding Grammar Rules
entries.annotation: The knowledge of essential grammar rules and how they apply to writing, such as the difference between "who" and "whom" and applying them correctly.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Mechanics
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Mechanics > Capitalization and Punctuation
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Mechanics > Capitalization and Punctuation > Applying Basic Capitalization Rules
entries.annotation: The knowledge of basic capitalization rules and their correct application in writing, such as capitalizing "New York City" or "Professor Smith.".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Mechanics > Capitalization and Punctuation > Applying Basic Punctuation Rules
entries.annotation: The ability to use punctuation marks correctly to clarify meaning and improve readability, such as placing commas correctly in a list: "apples, bananas, and oranges.".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Mechanics > Capitalization and Punctuation > Using Advanced Punctuation Techniques
entries.annotation: The skill of using advanced punctuation techniques, such as semicolons and dashes, to enhance writing, such as semicolons to link closely related independent clauses: "She loves reading; it’s her favorite hobby.".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Mechanics > Correcting Spelling Errors
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Mechanics > Correcting Spelling Errors > Applying Spelling Rules
entries.annotation: The knowledge of standard spelling rules and the ability to apply them to avoid spelling mistakes, like "I before E except after C" to avoid mistakes such as "recieve" corrected to "receive.".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Punctuation and Capitalization
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Punctuation and Capitalization > Apply Punctuation and Capitalization
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Punctuation and Capitalization > Apply Punctuation and Capitalization > Apply Punctuation and Capitalization
entries.annotation: The ability to apply punctuation and capitalization rules to convey meaning and improve readability.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Spelling
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Spelling > Apply Spelling Patterns and Rules
Language Expression > Writing > Mechanics and Conventions > Spelling > Apply Spelling Patterns and Rules > Apply Spelling Patterns and Rules
entries.annotation: The ability to spell accurately using patterns, rules, and reference tools as needed.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Citing Sources
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Citing Sources > Avoid Plagiarism and Cite Sources
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Citing Sources > Avoid Plagiarism and Cite Sources > Avoid Plagiarism and Cite Sources
entries.annotation: The ability to paraphrase accurately, quote appropriately, and use citation styles to credit sources.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Citing Sources > Avoiding Plagiarism
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Citing Sources > Avoiding Plagiarism > Paraphrasing Appropriately
entries.annotation: The skill of rephrasing information from sources accurately without copying, such as summarizing a paragraph in one's own words while retaining the original meaning.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Citing Sources > Avoiding Plagiarism > Understanding Plagiarism
entries.annotation: The comprehension of what constitutes plagiarism and how to avoid it in writing, such as recognizing the importance of crediting original authors.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Citing Sources > Providing Correct References
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Citing Sources > Providing Correct References > Listing References Accurately
entries.annotation: The ability to create accurate reference lists and bibliographies according to citation standards.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Citing Sources > Providing Correct References > Using Citation Styles (E.G., APA, MLA)
entries.annotation: The knowledge of standard citation styles and how to use them correctly in writing, such as in-text citations and reference lists.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Conducting Research
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Conducting Research > Formulate Questions and Gather/Evaluate Sources
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Conducting Research > Formulate Questions and Gather/Evaluate Sources > Formulate Questions and Gather/Evaluate Sources
entries.annotation: The ability to pose researchable questions, locate information, and evaluate source credibility.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Conducting Research > Gathering Sources
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Conducting Research > Gathering Sources > Collecting Relevant Information
entries.annotation: The skill of identifying and gathering information relevant to the research topic, such as finding academic articles related to a thesis statement.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Conducting Research > Gathering Sources > Evaluating Source Credibility
entries.annotation: The ability to evaluate the reliability and credibility of sources to ensure accurate information, such as assessing the author's credentials and the publication’s reputation.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Conducting Research > Researching Topics
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Conducting Research > Researching Topics > Finding Reliable Sources
entries.annotation: The skill of locating credible and reliable sources for information, such as peer-reviewed journals and authoritative books for accurate information.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Conducting Research > Researching Topics > Formulating Research Questions
entries.annotation: The knowledge of developing focused and relevant research questions to guide the investigation, such as "What are the effects of social media on teenagers’ self-esteem?".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Integrate and Attribute Evidence
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Integrate and Attribute Evidence > Integrate and Attribute Evidence
entries.annotation: The ability to integrate quotations and paraphrases with accurate attribution and present data clearly.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Integrating Quotes
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Integrating Quotes > Formatting Quotations
entries.annotation: The knowledge of formatting quotations correctly within the text to maintain clarity and flow, such as using block quotes for lengthy excerpts.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Integrating Quotes > Quoting Texts Correctly
entries.annotation: The ability to accurately quote texts, including using quotation marks and proper in-text citation, such as "As Smith states, 'social media impacts mental health' (Smith, 2020).".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Using Evidence
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Using Evidence > Citing Credible Sources
entries.annotation: The knowledge of citing sources correctly to provide evidence and give credit to original authors, such as using citations to support research claims.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Using Evidence > Integrating Quotes
entries.annotation: The skill of incorporating quotes smoothly into writing to support arguments and ideas, such as introducing quotes with lead-ins and explanations.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Using Evidence > Paraphrasing Information
entries.annotation: The ability to paraphrase information from sources accurately while maintaining the original meaning, such as rewording an author's point in one's own language.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Using Evidence Effectively
Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Using Evidence Effectively > Incorporating Quotations Properly
entries.annotation: The ability to use quotations effectively to enhance arguments and provide support, such as integrating quotes to back up key points in an essay.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Research and Evidence > Integrating Evidence > Using Evidence Effectively > Presenting Data Accurately
entries.annotation: The skill of presenting data and evidence accurately to support claims in writing, such as displaying statistics clearly in a research report.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice
Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Developing Style
Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Developing Style > Varying Sentence Structures
Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Developing Style > Varying Sentence Structures > Avoiding Repetition
entries.annotation: The ability to avoid repetitive sentence structures to maintain reader interest, such as varying the opening words and lengths of sentences.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Developing Style > Varying Sentence Structures > Combining Different Sentence Types
entries.annotation: The skill of using a variety of sentence structures to create a more engaging and dynamic writing style, such as mixing simple, compound, and complex sentences.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Developing Style > Varying Sentence Structures > Varying Sentence Structure
entries.annotation: The knowledge of altering sentence structures to improve the clarity and flow of writing, such as changing between passive and active voices as appropriate.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Developing Style > Varying Sentence Structures > Varying Sentence Structures
entries.annotation: The ability to vary sentence structures for improved readability and engagement, such as incorporating rhetorical questions and exclamations.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Developing Style > Writing with Style
Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Developing Style > Writing with Style > Using Descriptive Language
entries.annotation: The skill of enhancing writing with vivid and descriptive language to create clear imagery, such as describing a scene with sensory details.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Establishing Voice
Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Establishing Voice > Developing Writer’s Voice

entries.annotation: The skill of creating and maintaining a specific mood in writing to enhance reader experience, such as using suspenseful language in mystery stories.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Establishing Voice > Developing Writer’s Voice > Expressing Individual Perspective
entries.annotation: The skill of articulating personal viewpoints and perspectives effectively in writing, such as using first-person narrative in reflective essays.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Establishing Voice > Developing Writer’s Voice > Identifying Personal Style
entries.annotation: The ability to recognize and develop a unique writing style that reflects the writer's personality and voice, such as incorporating personal anecdotes.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Establishing Voice > Developing Writer’s Voice > Using Consistent Voice
entries.annotation: The ability to maintain a consistent voice throughout a piece of writing for coherence, such as keeping a formal tone in an academic paper.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Establishing Voice > Using Consistent Voice and Tone

entries.annotation: The ability to adjust writing voice and tone to suit the specific audience and context, such as using a conversational tone for blog posts.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Establishing Voice > Using Consistent Voice and Tone > Maintaining Voice Throughout Text
entries.annotation: The knowledge of how to sustain a consistent voice and tone from beginning to end of a text, such as maintaining a professional tone in a business report.

entries.annotation: The ability to modify tone to fit the purpose and audience of the writing, such as being respectful and conciliatory in a letter of apology.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Tone > Maintaining Appropriate Tone > Adjusting Tone for Audience
entries.annotation: The knowledge of how to tailor tone to effectively communicate with different audiences, such as using technical jargon for experts and simple language for the general public.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Tone > Maintaining Appropriate Tone > Recognizing Appropriate Tone
entries.annotation: The skill of identifying and using the appropriate tone for different writing contexts, such as formal, informal, or persuasive.

Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Tone > Setting the Tone > Establishing Initial Tone
entries.annotation: The skill of setting the tone of a piece from the beginning to shape reader expectations, such as starting with a serious tone for a legal document.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Style and Voice > Tone > Setting the Tone > Maintaining Tone Consistency
entries.annotation: The knowledge of keeping a consistent tone throughout the writing for clarity and coherence, such as maintaining a humorous tone in a satire.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process

entries.annotation: The skill of generating a wide range of ideas and topics for writing through brainstorming techniques, such as free writing or mind mapping.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Brainstorming > Generating Ideas > Exploring Creative Ideas
entries.annotation: The ability to think creatively and generate original ideas for writing, such as using prompts to spark new storylines.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Brainstorming > Structuring Ideas

entries.annotation: The skill of organizing and categorizing ideas logically during the brainstorming process, such as grouping related themes together.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Brainstorming > Structuring Ideas > Creating Idea Maps
entries.annotation: The ability to visualize connections between ideas through mind mapping, such as using diagrams to link concepts.

Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Drafting > Develop and Organize Drafts > Develop and Organize Drafts

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Drafting > Developing Drafts

entries.annotation: The skill of elaborating and developing initial ideas into detailed and coherent drafts, such as fleshing out bullet points into full paragraphs.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Drafting > Developing Drafts > Improving Draft Flow
entries.annotation: The ability to improve the flow and coherence of drafts through logical organization and transitions, such as linking paragraphs with transition sentences.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Drafting > Drafting Text

entries.annotation: The skill of refining and expanding drafts to enhance content and coherence, such as adding supporting details and examples.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Drafting > Drafting Text > Initial Drafting
entries.annotation: The knowledge of writing initial drafts to capture essential ideas and structure, such as creating the foundational layout for a novel.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Drafting > Drafting Text > Organizing Draft Content
entries.annotation: The ability to arrange content logically in drafts to improve clarity and readability, such as structuring arguments in a persuasive essay.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Drafting > Drafting Text > Writing Coherent Paragraphs
entries.annotation: The ability to write clear and coherent paragraphs that develop ideas effectively, such as ensuring each paragraph has a topic sentence and supporting details.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Drafting > Drafting Text > Writing Initial Drafts
entries.annotation: The skill of creating the initial draft of a text to capture the main ideas and structure, such as laying down the first version of a research paper.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Editing
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Editing > Correcting Writing
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Editing > Correcting Writing > Correcting Mistakes
entries.annotation: The knowledge of identifying and correcting mistakes in writing to improve accuracy and clarity, such as fixing punctuation errors.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Editing > Correcting Writing > Ensuring Consistency
entries.annotation: The ability to review and revise writing to ensure consistency in style and tone, such as maintaining the same tense throughout a story.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Editing > Correcting Writing > Proofreading for Spelling and Grammar
entries.annotation: The skill of proofreading writing to correct spelling and grammatical errors, such as identifying and fixing typos.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Editing > Editing Writing
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Editing > Editing Writing > Checking Grammar and Punctuation
entries.annotation: The skill of editing writing to correct grammatical and punctuation errors, such as ensuring subject-verb agreement.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Editing > Editing Writing > Refining Word Choice
entries.annotation: The ability to improve writing by selecting the most precise and effective words, such as replacing vague terms with specific vocabulary.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Feedback

Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Feedback > Peer Review > Providing Constructive Feedback
entries.annotation: The skill of giving useful and specific feedback to peers to help improve their writing, such as commenting on clarity and coherence.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Feedback > Peer Review > Reviewing Peers' Work
entries.annotation: The ability to critically review and evaluate the writing of peers, such as providing insights on argument strength and organization.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Feedback > Self-Evaluation
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Feedback > Self-Evaluation > Identifying Areas for Improvement
entries.annotation: The skill of recognizing specific aspects of one's writing that need enhancement, such as pinpointing sections that require more evidence.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Feedback > Self-Evaluation > Self-Review
entries.annotation: The knowledge of assessing one's own writing to identify strengths and areas for improvement, such as reviewing a draft for logical flow.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Brainstorming
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Brainstorming > Generating Ideas
entries.annotation: The ability to generate and explore a range of ideas for writing, such as listing potential topics for an essay.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Brainstorming > Organizing Thoughts
entries.annotation: The skill of organizing and structuring ideas logically before writing, such as outlining main points and supporting details.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Outlining Writing

entries.annotation: The skill of organizing ideas into outlines to guide the writing process, such as using headings and bullet points.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Outlining Writing > Organizing Topics Logically
entries.annotation: The ability to arrange topics logically within an outline to ensure coherence, such as sequencing arguments in a debate presentation.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Outlining Writing > Structuring Writing Logically
entries.annotation: The knowledge of creating outlines to structure writing logically, such as drafting an outline for a research paper.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Planning Writing
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Planning Writing > Setting Writing Goals
entries.annotation: The skill of establishing specific goals and objectives for writing projects, such as setting a word count target.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Planning Writing > Structuring Writing Plans
entries.annotation: The ability to create detailed plans to guide the writing process, such as scheduling drafting and revision phases.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Plan and Outline Writing
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Planning > Plan and Outline Writing > Plan and Outline Writing
entries.annotation: The ability to brainstorm, generate ideas, and create outlines that organize content logically.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Revising

entries.annotation: The ability to revise writing to improve clarity and understanding, such as simplifying complex sentences.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Revising > Refining Content > Improving Style
entries.annotation: The skill of refining the writing style to enhance readability and impact, such as varying sentence length and structure.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Process > Revising > Refining Content > Improving Word Choice
entries.annotation: The ability to choose the most effective words to enhance meaning and tone, such as replacing basic words with precise vocabulary.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Techniques

entries.annotation: The ability to create cohesion within and between paragraphs using transitions and referencing.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Techniques > Using Literary Devices

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Techniques > Using Literary Devices > Applying Metaphors > Integrating Metaphors Smoothly
entries.annotation: The ability to incorporate metaphors seamlessly into writing, such as using metaphors to enrich narrative descriptions.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Techniques > Using Literary Devices > Applying Metaphors > Using Personification
entries.annotation: The skill of employing personification to attribute human qualities to non-human entities, such as "The wind whispered secrets through the trees.".

Language Expression > Writing > Writing Techniques > Using Literary Devices > Applying Similes and Personification > Constructing Similes
entries.annotation: The ability to construct effective similes to enhance descriptions, such as "Her smile was as bright as the sun.".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Techniques > Using Literary Devices > Applying Similes and Personification > Creating Similes
entries.annotation: The knowledge of creating similes to add vividness and clarity, such as "Brave as a lion" or "Busy as a bee.".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types

entries.annotation: The skill of maintaining logical consistency across all arguments in the text, such as ensuring each point directly supports the thesis.

entries.annotation: The skill of developing clear, concise, and strong claims in argumentative writing, such as stating a clear thesis like "School uniforms should be mandatory in all schools.".

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Argumentative Writing > Crafting Arguments > Organizing Arguments Logically
entries.annotation: The ability to arrange arguments in a logical and coherent order, such as structuring an essay with clear sections for introduction, body, and conclusion.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Argumentative Writing > Develop Claims, Evidence, and Counterarguments

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Argumentative Writing > Using Evidence

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Argumentative Writing > Using Evidence > Demonstrating Evidentiary Logical Consistency
entries.annotation: The skill of incorporating evidence consistently to support all claims with logic, such as linking research data to the main argument throughout the essay.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Argumentative Writing > Using Evidence > Using Evidence to Support Claims

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing

Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Narrative Writing > Creating Engaging Plots
entries.annotation: The skill of developing captivating plots for narrative writing, such as creating conflict and resolution in a short story.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Narrative Writing > Creating Plot Structures
entries.annotation: The ability to establish plot structures that guide the sequence of events in a narrative, such as outlining beginning, middle, and end.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Narrative Writing > Creating Setting and Context
entries.annotation: The knowledge of crafting detailed settings and contexts that enhance narrative depth, such as describing the environment and atmosphere vividly.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Narrative Writing > Develop Narrative Elements and Structure
entries.annotation: The ability to develop plot, character, setting, and a coherent narrative arc.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Narrative Writing > Developing Characters
entries.annotation: The ability to create well-rounded and dynamic characters in stories, such as giving characters distinctive traits and backgrounds.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Narrative Writing > Setting Scenes
entries.annotation: The skill of placing scenes effectively to create imagery and mood, such as starting with a vivid description of the setting.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Narrative Writing > Structuring Story Arcs
entries.annotation: The skill of organizing narratives into coherent and compelling story arcs, such as following the hero's journey structure.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Poetry Writing
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Poetry Writing > Apply Poetic Devices and Structure
entries.annotation: The ability to use poetic devices and structures to convey meaning and imagery.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Poetry Writing > Applying Poetic Devices
entries.annotation: The knowledge of using poetic devices such as alliteration, assonance, and enjambment, such as alliteration, assonance, and enjambment to enhance the poem's texture and sound.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Poetry Writing > Crafting Imagery
entries.annotation: The ability to create vivid imagery that evokes sensory experiences in poetry, such as describing a scene with rich details.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Poetry Writing > Employing Rhythm and Rhyme
entries.annotation: The knowledge of using rhythm and rhyme to create musicality in poems, such as crafting rhyming couplets or maintaining a steady meter.

entries.annotation: The skill of utilizing different poetic structures to organize poems, such as sonnets, haikus, and free verse.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Creative Writing > Poetry Writing > Using Figurative Language
entries.annotation: The ability to incorporate figurative language to add depth and meaning to poetry, such as metaphors, similes, and symbolism.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing

Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing > Explain and Inform Clearly > Explain and Inform Clearly
entries.annotation: The ability to explain processes and ideas clearly using appropriate organization and supporting details.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing > Explaining Processes
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing > Explaining Processes > Breaking Down Steps
entries.annotation: The skill of clearly explaining processes step-by-step in informative writing, such as outlining the steps of a science experiment.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing > Explaining Processes > Clarifying Complex Processes
entries.annotation: The ability to simplify and clarify complex processes for the reader, such as explaining how photosynthesis works in clear steps.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing > Writing Informative Texts
Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing > Writing Informative Texts > Explaining Complex Ideas
entries.annotation: The skill of explaining complex ideas in a way that is easily understandable by the reader, such as breaking down a difficult concept into simpler terms.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing > Writing Informative Texts > Organizing Information Clearly
entries.annotation: The skill of arranging information logically and coherently for better understanding, such as using headings and subheadings.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing > Writing Informative Texts > Presenting Factual Information
entries.annotation: The knowledge of presenting factual and accurate information in a clear manner, such as writing a report on historical events.

entries.taxonomy_path: Language Expression > Writing > Writing Types > Informative Writing > Writing Informative Texts > Summarizing Key Points
entries.annotation: The ability to summarize key points effectively to reinforce understanding, such as concluding an article with the main takeaways.

entries.annotation: The ability to add sounds to the end of words, such as adding /s/ to 'cat' to make 'cats.'

Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Phonemic Awareness > Phoneme Manipulation > Deleting Phonemes > Deleting Initial Sounds
entries.annotation: The ability to remove the first sound from words, such as removing /s/ from 'stop' to make 'top.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Phonemic Awareness > Phoneme Manipulation > Deleting Phonemes > Deleting Final Sounds
entries.annotation: The ability to remove the last sound from words, such as removing /s/ from 'cats' to make 'cat.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Phonemic Awareness > Phoneme Manipulation > Substituting Phonemes
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Phonemic Awareness > Phoneme Manipulation > Substituting Phonemes > Substituting Initial Sounds
entries.annotation: The ability to change the first sound in words, such as changing /c/ in 'cat' to /b/ to make 'bat.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Phonemic Awareness > Phoneme Manipulation > Substituting Phonemes > Substituting Final Sounds
entries.annotation: The ability to change the last sound in words, such as changing /t/ in 'cat' to /p/ to make 'cap.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Syllable Awareness
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Syllable Awareness > Syllable Manipulation
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Syllable Awareness > Syllable Manipulation > Syllable Counting
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Syllable Awareness > Syllable Manipulation > Syllable Counting > Counting Syllables in Words
entries.annotation: The ability to count the number of syllables in spoken words, such as 'el-e-phant' has 3 syllables.

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Syllable Awareness > Syllable Manipulation > Syllable Segmentation
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Syllable Awareness > Syllable Manipulation > Syllable Segmentation > Breaking Words into Syllables
entries.annotation: The ability to divide words into their syllable components, such as 'win-dow' or 'com-pu-ter.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Syllable Awareness > Syllable Manipulation > Syllable Blending
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Syllable Awareness > Syllable Manipulation > Syllable Blending > Combining Syllables into Words
entries.annotation: The ability to put syllables together to form complete words, such as 'win' + 'dow' = 'window.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Rhyme Recognition
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Rhyme Recognition > Identifying Rhyming Words
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Rhyme Recognition > Identifying Rhyming Words > Recognizing Rhyming Patterns
entries.annotation: The ability to recognize words that have the same ending sounds, such as 'cat' and 'hat.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Rhyme Production
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Rhyme Production > Generating Rhyming Words
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Rhyme Production > Generating Rhyming Words > Producing Rhyming Patterns
entries.annotation: The ability to produce words that rhyme with a given word, such as generating 'bat,' 'sat,' 'mat' for 'cat.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Alliteration Recognition
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Alliteration Recognition > Identifying Alliterative Patterns
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Alliteration Recognition > Identifying Alliterative Patterns > Recognizing Alliterative Sequences
entries.annotation: The ability to recognize words that begin with the same sound, such as 'big brown bear.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Alliteration Production
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Alliteration Production > Generating Alliterative Sequences
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Rhyme and Alliteration > Alliteration Production > Generating Alliterative Sequences > Producing Alliterative Patterns
entries.annotation: The ability to create sequences of words that begin with the same sound, such as 'silly snakes slither.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Advanced Phonemic Awareness
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Advanced Phonemic Awareness > Complex Manipulation
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Advanced Phonemic Awareness > Complex Manipulation > Phoneme Reversal
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Advanced Phonemic Awareness > Complex Manipulation > Phoneme Reversal > Reversing Phoneme Order
entries.annotation: The ability to reverse the order of sounds in words, such as changing 'top' to 'pot.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Advanced Phonemic Awareness > Complex Manipulation > Multiple Phoneme Changes
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Advanced Phonemic Awareness > Complex Manipulation > Multiple Phoneme Changes > Changing Multiple Sounds
entries.annotation: The ability to change multiple sounds in words, such as changing 'cat' to 'dog' by substituting all phonemes.

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Advanced Phonemic Awareness > Phoneme Position
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Advanced Phonemic Awareness > Phoneme Position > Medial Phoneme Manipulation
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Advanced Phonemic Awareness > Phoneme Position > Medial Phoneme Manipulation > Changing Middle Sounds
entries.annotation: The ability to manipulate sounds in the middle of words, such as changing 'bit' to 'bat' by changing the medial vowel.

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Word Awareness
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Word Awareness > Word Boundaries
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Word Awareness > Word Boundaries > Identifying Word Boundaries
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Word Awareness > Word Boundaries > Identifying Word Boundaries > Recognizing Word Segmentation
entries.annotation: The ability to recognize where words begin and end in spoken language, such as hearing 'big dog' as two separate words.

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Word Awareness > Word Counting
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Word Awareness > Word Counting > Counting Words in Sentences
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Word Awareness > Word Counting > Counting Words in Sentences > Counting Spoken Words
entries.annotation: The ability to count the number of words in spoken sentences, such as 'The cat runs' has 3 words.

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Onset Recognition
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Onset Recognition > Identifying Onsets
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Onset Recognition > Identifying Onsets > Recognizing Onset Sounds
entries.annotation: The ability to identify the beginning sound(s) of syllables, such as /bl/ in 'black.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Rime Recognition
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Rime Recognition > Identifying Rimes
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Rime Recognition > Identifying Rimes > Recognizing Rime Patterns
entries.annotation: The ability to identify the vowel and following consonants in syllables, such as /ack/ in 'black.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Onset-Rime Manipulation
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Onset-Rime Manipulation > Changing Onsets
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Onset-Rime Manipulation > Changing Onsets > Substituting Onset Sounds
entries.annotation: The ability to change the beginning sounds while keeping the rime, such as changing 'cat' to 'bat' to 'hat.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Onset-Rime Manipulation > Changing Rimes
Word Recognition > Phonological Awareness > Onset-Rime Awareness > Onset-Rime Manipulation > Changing Rimes > Substituting Rime Patterns
entries.annotation: The ability to change the ending sounds while keeping the onset, such as changing 'cat' to 'can' to 'cap.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Sight Recognition
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Mapping
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Mapping > Sight Vocabulary
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Mapping > Sight Vocabulary > Recognize High-frequency and Irregular Words
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Mapping > Sight Vocabulary > Recognize High-frequency and Irregular Words > Recognize High-frequency and Irregular Words
entries.annotation: The ability to instantly recognize high-frequency and irregular words through orthographic mapping.

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Mapping > Sight Vocabulary > Recognizing High-frequency Words
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Mapping > Sight Vocabulary > Recognizing High-frequency Words > Differentiating Similar High-frequency Words
entries.annotation: The ability to distinguish between high-frequency words that may be visually or phonetically similar. For example: Distinguishing between "there" and "their".

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Mapping > Sight Vocabulary > Recognizing Instant Words
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Mapping > Sight Vocabulary > Recognizing Instant Words > Recognizing Instant Words Without Phonetic Cues

levels.skill_subset: Recognizing Instant Words Without Phonetic Cues

entries.annotation: The skill of identifying common words instantly without relying on phonetic decoding. For example: Instantly recognizing the word "said".

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Processing
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Processing > Visual Word Recognition
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Processing > Visual Word Recognition > Orthographic Neighborhood Effects
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Processing > Visual Word Recognition > Orthographic Neighborhood Effects > Processing Visually Similar Words
entries.annotation: The ability to distinguish between visually similar words, such as 'house' vs. 'horse.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Processing > Visual Word Recognition > Letter Position Encoding
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Orthographic Processing > Visual Word Recognition > Letter Position Encoding > Processing Letter Position Information
entries.annotation: The ability to encode the position of letters within words for accurate recognition, such as distinguishing 'form' from 'from.'

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Sight Vocabulary Development
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Sight Vocabulary Development > High-frequency Words
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Sight Vocabulary Development > High-frequency Words > Building Sight Vocabulary
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Sight Vocabulary Development > High-frequency Words > Building Sight Vocabulary > Developing Automatic Word Recognition
entries.annotation: The ability to build a repertoire of instantly recognizable words through repeated exposure and practice.

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Sight Vocabulary Development > Irregular Words
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Sight Vocabulary Development > Irregular Words > Exception Word Learning
Word Recognition > Sight Recognition > Sight Vocabulary Development > Irregular Words > Exception Word Learning > Learning Irregular Spelling Patterns
entries.annotation: The ability to learn and remember words with irregular spelling patterns that cannot be decoded phonetically.

Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Accuracy and Rate
Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Accuracy and Rate > Word-Level Accuracy
Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Accuracy and Rate > Word-Level Accuracy > Maintaining Word Reading Accuracy
Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Accuracy and Rate > Word-Level Accuracy > Maintaining Word Reading Accuracy > Sustaining Accurate Word Recognition
entries.annotation: The ability to maintain accurate word recognition across various text types and difficulty levels.

entries.taxonomy_path: Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Accuracy and Rate > Word-Level Rate
Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Accuracy and Rate > Word-Level Rate > Appropriate Word Reading Rate
Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Accuracy and Rate > Word-Level Rate > Appropriate Word Reading Rate > Reading Words at Appropriate Speed
entries.annotation: The ability to read words at a rate that supports comprehension without sacrificing accuracy.

Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Efficiency > Processing Efficiency
Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Efficiency > Processing Efficiency > Effortless Word Recognition
Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Efficiency > Processing Efficiency > Effortless Word Recognition > Automatic Word Processing
entries.annotation: The ability to recognize words with minimal cognitive effort, freeing resources for comprehension.

Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Efficiency > Resource Allocation > Cognitive Load Management
Word Recognition > Word Reading Fluency > Efficiency > Resource Allocation > Cognitive Load Management > Balancing Decoding and Comprehension
